title: zeroCrossing~
description: The `zeroCrossing~` object measures the noisiness or frequency-related characteristics of an audio signal by counting how many times it crosses the zero amplitude point within a specified window. It outputs this count as a numerical feature, often used as a crude timbre descriptor. Users can set the analysis window size via a creation argument or a 'window' message, and it's recommended to apply an amplitude threshold before measurement to avoid low-level noise interference.
